title: chigo
author: chigo
content: QuoteStereotypically, gender is also cited as one of the reasons why people like to gamble. One of the research findings shows that women tend to prefer percentage-odds-based games and men tend to prefer skill-based games.For example, poker, from a man's point of view is considered a skill-based gamble. While women see it as a game of calculating the odds. In gambling, generally, women don't like it when others see them lose. Girls probably prefer slot machines because no one sees players win or lose.Gambling with slot machines is often a personal experience free of guilt or shame. While the men are not like that.According to research, when a man loses a gamble, there's a machismo attached to him saying, "Yeah, I lost £500, but I can afford it."And when you win big, guys like it to be exposed right away. Because, they consider this as part of the skill.This difference in reasons does not necessarily indicate whether men prefer to gamble than women. Women who like to gamble or men who like to gamble are both related to the courage to take risks.For different reasons, people who like to gamble see it as fun and for reasons that are more complex than just economics.Read more (use google translate)Do you think the results of the research above are correct?I know that the number of women involved in gambling is very small because in some countries, people's views of female gamblers are still very bad and they are considered dirty and unfit to be a wife. maybe the results of this research can be used by gambling business owners in developing their business.

comments.body: The research is correct in attaching winning and losing to machismo, there is a level of machismo if the man is gambling and they tend to attract the opposite sex and admiration from the same sex, not everyone can gamble and sustain it or can boast that he lose but its doesn't matter to him.If a man can do this sustain and boast then he is displaying machismo, Women do not want to display their winning and losing and they tend to be conservative that is my opinion I have women friends who gamble and they are conservative when it comes to losing and winning they prefer to keep this to themselves or circle of friends.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: I believe that women (perhaps un order to avoid the stigma associated to being a gambler) turn to social gambling which may be more acceptable in their communities. For example,.When I used to visit my motherly half of my family the whole neighborhood would usually gather together to play cards and lottery at night. Many women participated and even their spouses and children were usually around playing football with other children. And nobody cares because it was viewed as a tradition and as something which brought the community together. On the other hand, I think my family would have frown upon on someone getting used to play on a slot machine too often.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: I don't know whether the research results are correct or not because of course research will really depend on the results of each sample taken and also the place where the research is carried out can greatly affect the results. Maybe why many think that men will be more involved in gambling than women because women are not open when asked and are also used to doing it in secret because of society's judgment that gambling is bad, especially women who do it, but if this is true, the reason could be because women are more afraid losing money where gambling is very possible, and prefer to use their money for certain things or pleasures that can be felt immediately, such as buying items that can be used, such as clothes or bags.
